intro: Didymocarpus yuenlingensis, commonly known as Yuenling tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yuenling Mountains in Guangxi Province. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
